title: Helping Your Anxious Teen
description: This book provides practical, evidence-based guidance for parents supporting teenagers with anxiety. Drawing from cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) principles, it offers strategies to help parents understand anxiety, foster resilience, and empower teens to face their fears. The book emphasizes collaborative problem-solving, healthy communication, and gradual exposure to anxiety-provoking situations. It also addresses common parental pitfalls and provides tools to support both teens and parents throughout the journey.

modules.title: Understanding Teen Anxiety
modules.goal: Help parents recognize and understand the nature and impact of anxiety in teenagers.
key_points: Identify common symptoms and types of anxiety seen in teens.
Explore why anxiety increases during adolescence, including biological and social factors.
Learn how anxiety can affect daily functioning and family dynamics.

modules.title: Parental Responses to Anxiety
modules.goal: Teach parents how their reactions can influence their teen's anxiety.
key_points: Understand common parental behaviors that unintentionally reinforce anxiety.
Recognize the difference between supportive and enabling responses.
Learn how to validate feelings without accommodating avoidance behaviors.

modules.title: Building Resilience and Confidence
modules.goal: Guide parents in fostering resilience and healthy coping skills in their teens.
key_points: Encourage teens to face fears through gradual exposure.
Support the development of independence and self-efficacy.

modules.title: Collaborative Problem-Solving
modules.goal: Introduce effective communication and problem-solving strategies for families.
key_points: Learn how to have open, non-judgmental conversations about anxiety.
Set realistic expectations and goals together.
Develop step-by-step plans for managing anxiety-provoking situations.

modules.title: Managing Setbacks and Parental Self-Care
modules.goal: Prepare parents to handle setbacks and maintain their own well-being.
key_points: Recognize that setbacks are a normal part of progress.
Develop strategies for staying calm and consistent during challenging moments.
Practice self-care and seek support when needed.
